headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT--FEB. 23. THE CUBAN KIDNAPPING CASE. Proceedings in the United States District Court--Interesting Affidavits. A Robbery Two Years Ago. The Market Bank Embezzlement Case. Hard Work and Poor Pay. Mayor's Complaint Book.. COMMON COUNCIL PROCEEDINGS. Board of Aldermen The $1,500 Robbery Case Dismissed. A Complaint from Tuckahoe. Young Men's Democratic Union Club Ball. Ascent on the Tight Wire. Railroad Accident. Last of the Anti-Slavery Lectures.

docs.lead_paragraph: Before Judge Betts. Francisco E. Hernandez vs. Francis Stoughton and Cristoval Carnoveli.--The motion in this case to vacate or modify the order holding the defendants to hail in this action, was brought on at the opening of Court this morning. All parties were present, in Court, together with quite a number of swarthy, whiskered and mustached spectators, evidently talking a great interest in the proceedings.

headline.main: Another New City Charter.; IMPORTANT AMENDMENTS, A Defenoe of the Board of Councilmen. A FOURTH DRAFT OF THE ACT. THE CHOICE OF THE COUNCILMEN.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Board of Councilmen last evening unanimously adopted the following draft of an Amended City Charter, as reported by. the Law Committee of that Board: The Committee on the Law Department, to whom was referred the subject of amendments to the City Charter; also; so much of the Mayor's communication of Jan. 12 as relates to a change of the Charter election to the Spring of the year, respectfully.

headline.main: EUROPEAN AFFAIRS.; British Ministry--Palmerston and his Coleagues--Their War and Peace Views-The War in the Crimea.

docs.lead_paragraph: The way and manner in which the Cabinet crisis, terminated may be taken for the foreshadowing of the way and manner in which the war will terminate. We have the status quo ante crisis, with a compromise. A Cabinet is patched up--as will be the peace--from the old materials, and after mutual compliment to satisfy one another amour propre.

headline.main: THE FINANCES OF THE CITY.; Annual Report of the Comptroller.

docs.lead_paragraph: The following Report, being the Annual Statement of Comptroller FLAGG in regard to the finances of the City, was send to the Board of Councilmen on Wednesday night: DEPARTMENT OF FINANCE COMPTROLLERS OFFICE, CITY OF NEW-YORK, Feb. 21, 1855. To the Common Council:

headline.main: QUARANTINE.; DR. CARNOCHAN ON THE PROPOSED CHANGE. THE PROPOSAL TO ALTER ITS LOCATION.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Quarantine. The following communication from the Surgeon in Chief of the Emigrant Refuge Hospital on Ward's Island, on the bill now before the Legislature on the removal of the Quarantine from Staten Island, was read and referred to a Special Committee for immediate action:

docs.lead_paragraph: BROADWAY THEATRE.--Mr. E. L. DAVENPORT has been fulfilling an engagement here during the week, and has played in a variety of characters to moderate houses. Mr. DAVENPORT is a discreet and excellent actor, but lacks physique for heavy tragedy. In such characters as Saint Mare he is seen to best advantage; the modern drama is unquestionably his forte. ?

headline.main: Death of Hon. David D. Spencer.

WASHINGTON'S BIRTHDAY.; SPEECH OF GEN. LESLIE COOMES. One Hundred and Twenty-third Anniversary Oration of Thos. R. Whitney--Performances at the Academy of Music, &c. &c. CEREMONIES IN NEW-YORK AND SUBURBS, MILITARY AND CIVIC PARADES.

docs.lead_paragraph: Yesterday was the One Hundred and Twenty-third Anniversary of the Birthday of GEORGE WASHINGTON, -- and the event was celebrated in this City wit a degree of enthusiasm which was quite unusual. The ceremonies of the same day last Winter, were altogether inferior in interest to those of yesterday.

headline.main: Berenvement and Trials of an Emigrant Family.

docs.lead_paragraph: The phrase " strangers in a strange land," was emphatically illustrated in a case which came under our notice on Saturday evening. headline.main: The Passage of the Passenger Bill in the House-The Texas Debt Bill-The Fair of the Metropolitan Mechanics' Institute.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. SEWARD's bill regulating the carriage of passengers in steamships and other vessels--which was laid over in the Senate, a day or two ago, in consequence of Mr. BENJAMIN's statement that Mr. FISH desired no other than the bill of the Select Committee to pass,--was taken up in the House this morning, considered and promptly passed.
